intro: Conocephalus oblanceolatus, commonly known as the narrow-leafed conocephalus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae, commonly referred to as sedges. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered flower heads. Native to various regions in Asia, it thrives in moist, well-drained soils, often found in wetlands or along stream banks. The plant produces pale to brownish flowers, which are typically wind-pollinated. It plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for small aquatic organisms.
